subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: get your news in QS!
msgSnippet: ... Ah, thanks.  This is very interesting.  Between the 15 vowel digraphs and the stress marks, we can separate all the lexical sets perfectly except for
messageBody:
Ted Larson Freeman scripsit:
> The CMU Dictionary is here:
> http://www.speech.cs.cmu.edu/cgi-bin/cmudict

Ah, thanks. This is very interesting. Between the 15 vowel digraphs
and the stress marks, we can separate all the lexical sets perfectly
except for THOUGHT = CLOTH, TRAP = BATH, and LOT = PALM. However,
at least two of these can be differentiated by looking at the Orthodox:
LOT and CLOTH words are spelled with a single "o", whereas THOUGHT
and PALM words are not.

TRAP = BATH is more difficult. Generally speaking a word belongs with
BATH only if the At is followed by any of Fee, See, Thaw, No-See, No-Tea,
No-Cheer, No-Day, or May-Pea-Low. However, many words of this type
are still in TRAP, fairly unpredictably.

--

> The CMU Dictionary is here:
> http://www.speech.cs.cmu.edu/cgi-bin/cmudict

at least two of these can be differentiated by looking at the Orthodox:
